docs.abstract: Shifting schedules have long been a complaint in the retail field. A study of Gap stores showed that more consistent scheduling produced higher sales.
docs.snippet: Shifting schedules have long been a complaint in the retail field. A study of Gap stores showed that more consistent scheduling produced higher sales.
docs.lead_paragraph: In recent years, studies have shown that erratic work schedules can take a major toll on the well-being of service workers.

headline.main: A Find at Gap: Steady Hours Can Help Workers, and Profits
headline.print_headline: Steady Shifts for Workers Help Stores, Too

docs.abstract: The National Labor Relations Board’s chief lawyer, a Trump appointee, is moving to reach a settlement to avert a landmark ruling against the company.
docs.snippet: The National Labor Relations Board’s chief lawyer, a Trump appointee, is moving to reach a settlement to avert a landmark ruling against the company.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Trump appointee charged with enforcing federal labor rights is moving to head off a court ruling in a case against McDonald’s that could redefine the accountability of companies for their franchisees’ employment practices.

headline.main: Push to Settle McDonald’s Case, a Threat to Franchise Model
headline.print_headline: Franchise  Settlement Steers Clear Of Solution

docs.abstract: The three companies will create a new venture with the goal of simplifying coverage for their employees, in a move that unsettled the health care world.
docs.snippet: The three companies will create a new venture with the goal of simplifying coverage for their employees, in a move that unsettled the health care world.
docs.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — Three corporate behemoths — Amazon, Berkshire Hathaway and JPMorgan Chase — announced on Tuesday that they would form an independent health care company for their employees in the United States.

headline.main: Amazon, Berkshire Hathaway and JPMorgan Team Up to Try to Disrupt Health Care
headline.print_headline: 3 Giants Form Health Alliance, Rocking Insurers

byline.original: By Nick Wingfield, Katie Thomas and Reed Abelson

docs.abstract: The transaction comes as insurers and others are looking for ways to control costs and stave off future challenges from companies like Amazon.
docs.snippet: The transaction comes as insurers and others are looking for ways to control costs and stave off future challenges from companies like Amazon.
docs.lead_paragraph: The health insurance giant Cigna said on Thursday that it had agreed to buy Express Scripts, the nation’s largest pharmacy benefit manager, in a $52 billion deal that could further reshape the roiling health care landscape.

headline.main: Cigna to Buy Express Scripts in $52 Billion Health Care Deal
headline.print_headline: Cigna to Pay $52 Billion To Diversify

byline.original: By Katie Thomas, Reed Abelson and Chad Bray

docs.abstract: Universal state health coverage has rallied Democrats in the governor’s race. But even with the state’s size and wealth, it would be hard to achieve.
docs.snippet: Universal state health coverage has rallied Democrats in the governor’s race. But even with the state’s size and wealth, it would be hard to achieve.
docs.lead_paragraph: If wholesale opposition to President Trump is one litmus test for progressive Democrats, another — as the governor’s race in California is proving — is health care.

headline.main: Single-Payer Health Care in California: Here’s What It Would Take
headline.print_headline: Single-Payer A Tall Order For Liberals In California

byline.original: By Patricia Cohen and Reed Abelson

docs.abstract: Ye Jianming cast himself as a new kind of private entrepreneur in China, but his company now faces legal challenges at home and in the United States.
docs.snippet: Ye Jianming cast himself as a new kind of private entrepreneur in China, but his company now faces legal challenges at home and in the United States.
docs.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — A mysterious Chinese buyer surprised the financial world last year when it swooped in to buy a $9 billion chunk of Russia’s state oil company. Few outside China had ever heard of the firm, called CEFC China Energy, or could explain how it would complete — or even pay for — such an expensive and politically sensitive deal.

headline.main: Hard-Charging Chinese Energy Tycoon Falls From Xi Government’s Graces
headline.print_headline: Oil Company In Shadows Is Squeezed By China

docs.abstract: Brian Acton, one of the creators of WhatsApp, sold his company to the internet giant for $19 billion. Now he’s telling people to “#deletefacebook.”
docs.snippet: Brian Acton, one of the creators of WhatsApp, sold his company to the internet giant for $19 billion. Now he’s telling people to “#deletefacebook.”
docs.lead_paragraph: As Silicon Valley experiences a wave of criticism, even some former colleagues are becoming adversaries.

headline.main: Facebook Made Him a Billionaire. Now He’s a Critic.
headline.print_headline: Silicon Valley Critics Include Entrepreneur Facebook Made Rich

docs.abstract: Confronting Beijing over trade abuses is not without merit. But rejecting economic alliances opens the way to Chinese initiatives around the region.
docs.snippet: Confronting Beijing over trade abuses is not without merit. But rejecting economic alliances opens the way to Chinese initiatives around the region.
docs.lead_paragraph: Since the days of the Nixon administration nearly 50 years ago, American policy has aimed to steer China out of its isolation to prosper in the global market economy. There needn’t be conflict between the established superpower and the emerging giant, the best strategic minds argued. As it grew rich, they reasoned, China could be integrated peacefully into the institutional framework built by the Western powers from the rubble of World War II.

headline.main: Trump’s China Policy Has a Flaw: It Makes China the Winner
headline.print_headline: Who Wins in Trump’s China Policy? China

docs.abstract: Retaliatory tariffs are a blow to exporters increasingly catering to young, newly wealthy Chinese looking for bottles with cachet.
docs.snippet: Retaliatory tariffs are a blow to exporters increasingly catering to young, newly wealthy Chinese looking for bottles with cachet.
docs.lead_paragraph: Cabernet isn’t the most obvious pawn in a trade war between the United States and China. Airplanes and their parts are the leading American export to China. Soybeans and wheat grow in Trump country.

headline.main: China Finds California Wine Pairs Well With a Trade War
headline.print_headline: Pairs Well With a Trade War

docs.abstract: In theory, China has leverage as the White House considers tariffs, but selling Treasuries would end up costing China.
docs.snippet: In theory, China has leverage as the White House considers tariffs, but selling Treasuries would end up costing China.
docs.lead_paragraph: China’s wherewithal to play rough in a trade war with the United States is not as strong as it looks. Beijing is mulling whether to slow or halt purchases of United States Treasuries, Bloomberg reported on Wednesday. The reason may simply be to diversify assets. But as the largest foreign holder of Uncle Sam’s liabilities with $1.2 trillion, China also appears to have some leverage as the Trump administration considers imposing tariffs. Like other retaliatory measures, however, ditching Treasuries would end up costing China.

headline.main: China’s Weak Hand in Potential Trade War With U.S.
